flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction:
The story begins in Waves class, with an extra credit problem about the resonant frequency of an oscillating slinky. In the outline of the experiment in the textbook (which was quite dated), a record player was used as the drive wheel to transfer the circular motion into the rectilinear motion of a string. And so, my challenge is to make an analogue from scratch, but will I also be able to tell if I've over-engineered? Will I end up with a do-nothing doo-hickey or a malfunctioning geegaw? Can I still get extra credit for a class I've already finished?

Stay tuned to find out!
